findings.title: Suboptimal memory usage
findings.description: The StakingPool contract uses two mappings which can be optimized by using an accumulation pattern as described in the article 'Scalable Reward Distribution on the Ethereum Blockchain'. This can help reduce memory usage.

findings.title: StakingPool Constructor: poolTokenAmount parameter is not needed
findings.description: The poolTokenAmount parameter in the StakingPool constructor is unnecessary and can be removed.

findings.title: Insecure Function Visibility
findings.description: The getMultiplier function can be made internal to restrict access and prevent potential security risks.

findings.title: Functions stakeTokens and withdrawStake. Code duplication
findings.description: Function stakeTokens has almost the same component as withdrawStake function.
